Narrative:
AT APPROXIMATELY 0800 MONDAY MAY 18, 2009, NO. 210-18, NORTHERN MAINE JCT. SINGLE-MAN SWITCH ENGINEDERAILED 15TH THROUGH 18TH HEAD CARS WHILE PULLING NO. 203-17’S INBOUND TRAIN DOWN THE SOUTH FREIGHTTRACK AT “THE FARM” IN HERMON YARD.  AT THE TIME OF THE DERAILMENT, THE HEAD-END HAD ENTERED TRACKNO. 6 LOOP (CLOCK-WISE).

NO INJURIES; NO HAZMAT RELEASE.

POINT OF DERAILMENT WAS AT THE RIGHT-HAND SWITCH POINT OF THE NO. 90 SWITCH; R2 WHEEL (LEADING WHEEL OF TRAILING TRUCK) OF PROX 16219, LOAD SULPHURIC ACID, CLIMBED THE SWITCH POINT AND TRAVELED APPROXIMATELY FOUR INCHES ON TOP OF THE RAIL BEFORE FALLING IN BETWEEN THE POINT AND STOCK RAIL.  R2 WHEEL ON PROX 16219 WAS FOUND TO HAVE A SHARP FLANGE. THIS NON-CONDEMNING  WHEEL WITH SHARP FLANGE IS BELIEVED TO HAVE CAUSED THE DERAILMENT.THE LOCOMOTIVE AND 14 CARS PRIOR TO PROX 16219 SAFELY NEGOTIATED THE POINT BEFORE THE DERAILMENT OCCURRED.


DERAILED CARS:

15TH HEAD           CRGX  30056 LOAD (ETHANOL); “A” (TRAILING TRUCK);UPRIGHT, IN-LINE WITH TRACK
16TH HEAD           PROX  16219 LOAD (SULPHURIC ACID) ALL WHEELS; UPRIGHT, REAR OF CAR AT APPROXIMATE 45-DEGREE ANGLE TO TRACK
17TH HEAD           GATX  7992 LOAD (SULPHURIC ACID) ALL WHEELS; UPRIGHT, FRONT OF CAR AT APPROXIMATE 35-DEGREE ANGLE TO TRACK (AND 80-DEGREEANGLE TO PRECEDING CAR)
18TH HEAD           GATX 95 LOAD (SULPHURIC ACID) “B” (LEADING TRUCK); UPRIGHT, IN-LINE WITH TRACK, TRAILING TRUCK WHEELS APPROXIMATELY FOUR FEET FROM RAIL
